repnme.cdata!:
Mozambique - Water Private Sector Contracts
            OBA for Coverage Expansion Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Mozambique Water Private Sector
            Contracts OBA for Coverage Expansion Project received a
            satisfactory outcome with low or negligible risk to
            development outcome. The Banks performance was moderately
            satisfactory while the Grantees performance was
            satisfactory. Restructuring included a revision of the PDO,
            as follows: The objective of the Project is to increase
            access to piped water for the poor in the Recipients city
            of Maputo. Specifically, this change included the removal of
            the four secondary cities and of the modality of providing
            output-based payments to private operators. At restructuring
            the total number of connections remained the same, but the
            allocations for the four cities were transferred for
            implementation in Maputo. Revised outcome indicators were
            therefore changed to reflect the new connection targets for
            Maputo. The following seven lessons were learned from this
            project: (1) Output-based payments do not inherently provide
            incentives for change in behavior or investment. (2)
            Output-based programs need to assess ability of the
            recipient to pre-finance investments and consider
            pre-financing support mechanisms. (3) Verification
            procedures should focus on the ultimate objectives of the
            operation. (4) There needs to be a very strong understanding
            of the characteristics of the intended beneficiaries. (5)
            All the costs of program implementation accruing to the
            operator should be factored into the Output Based Aid (OBA)
            payments. (6) There needs to be a full appraisal at the time
            of project restructuring. (7) Implementation arrangements
            need to be realistic; assumptions regarding implementation
            need to be linked to the relevant project, rather than to
            goals related to other projects or programs.

repnme.cdata!:
Mozambique - Water Private Sector Contracts
            OBA for Coverage Expansion Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Water
            Private Sector Contracts OBA for Coverage Expansion Project
            is to assist low income households with subsidized yard
            connections to the water distribution network in Maputo and
            four secondary cities (the northern cities of Beira,
            Quelimane, Nampula and Pemba). The re-structured grant will
            re-allocate the existing funds from the four northern cities
            to Maputo. Poor households who cannot afford to pay
            connection costs are currently excluded from the water
            network. The purpose of this paper is to restructuring of
            grant agreement no.TF091213 by modifying the development
            objectives, revising the components, reallocating the grant
            proceeds between components, cancelling US$1.0 million, and
            extending the closing date of the grant from December 31,
            2011 to June 30, 2014.

Mozambique - Water Private Sector
            Contracts OBA for Coverage Expansion Project : restructuring
